meanings.definition: A slight gust or puff of air.
meanings.sent1: I felt a whiff of wind on my face.
meanings.sent2: The whiff of fresh air was refreshing.
meanings.sent3: As I opened the window, a whiff of air blew my papers away.
meanings.sent4: The whiff of wind carried the scent of flowers from the garden.
meanings.sent5: The gentle whiff of air rustled the leaves in the trees.

meanings.sent1: I caught a whiff of the delicious food from the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The whiff of perfume lingered in the room.
meanings.sent3: A whiff of smoke from the barbecue made my mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The whiff of fresh bread baking filled the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The whiff of a skunk's spray made me wrinkle my nose in disgust.

meanings.definition: To inhale a short, quick breath.
meanings.sent1: She had to whiff quickly to blow out the candle.
meanings.sent2: He whiffed in the scent of the flowers.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to whiff in as much air as possible before going underwater.
meanings.sent4: The runner whiffed in deeply before starting the race.
meanings.sent5: I whiffed in the fresh morning air to wake myself up.

meanings.definition: To give off a slight, passing odor.
meanings.sent1: The flowers whiffed a sweet fragrance into the room.
meanings.sent2: The bakery whiffed the smell of freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent3: The garbage can whiffed a terrible stench that made me gag.
meanings.sent4: The campfire whiffed smoke into our eyes.
meanings.sent5: The skunk whiffed its warning scent to keep predators away.
